node.title: Prime Minister forced to backtrack after claiming he told opposition about Hawaiian holiday
node.alt: The Prime Minister scowls as he stands on the floor of the House of Representatives.
node.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison claimed he had told the opposition he was headed to Hawaii during the catastrophic bushfires in 2019 — only to be made to clarify his comments twice just hours later.
node.content:
["The Prime Minister has been forced to backtrack after telling Parliament that Labor leader Anthony Albanese was \"fully aware\" he was headed to Hawaii during the catastrophic bushfires in late 2019.\u00a0", "Prime Minister Scott Morrison cut short a family holiday to Hawaii after significant criticism over being absent during the bushfire crisis.", "During Question Time, Labor challenged Scott Morrison on whether he attempted to cover up his overseas trip during the Black Summer bushfires which engulfed south-eastern Australia two\u00a0years ago.\u00a0", "Mr Morrison initially claimed he told Mr Albanese he was going to Hawaii, but within hours he\u00a0twice attempted to correct the record, finally admitting he had not disclosed his holiday destination.\u00a0", "The issue erupted when Labor MP Fiona Phillips questioned the Prime Minister about the Hawaiian holiday.", "\"When my electorate was burning, the Prime Minister's office told journalists he was not on holiday in Hawaii, why did the Prime Minister's office say that when it wasn't true?\" she said.\u00a0", "Mr Morrison responded by saying he had texted Mr Albanese while en route to Hawaii, informing him about where he was going.\u00a0", "\"I texted him from the plane when I was going on that leave\u00a0and told him where I was going and he was fully aware of where I was travelling with my family,\" Mr Morrison said.\u00a0", "
PM forced to clarify: 'Where I was going was on leave'
", "Moments after Question Time concluded, Mr Albanese denied the claim, saying it \"is not true\".\u00a0", "\"On the 15th of December, 2019, at 9:44pm, the Prime Minister did text me saying he was going on leave. He did not tell me where he was going. He said he was going with his family. I kept that text message confidential, as you do with private text messages between private phones,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"On the Friday, he disclosed in an interview with 2GB that he had texted me\u00a0and that was the first time that that became public.\u00a0", "\"But at no stage did he tell me where he was going.\"", "Mr Morrison then walked back his earlier language while hitting out at Mr Albanese.\u00a0", "\"Where I was going was on leave,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"He knew I was taking leave, Mr Speaker, I told him I was taking leave, and Mr Speaker, he chose to politicise that and has done so ever since.\"\u00a0", "After a brief period of bipartisanship to acknowledge outgoing speaker Tony Smith, Mr Morrison returned to the dispatch box to offer a further explanation.\u00a0", "\"When I was referring to 'he knew where I was going and was fully aware I was travelling with my family',\u00a0what I meant was that we were going on leave together,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"I simply told him that I was taking leave with my family, and he was aware of that at that time.\"", "With a pseudo-election campaign afoot, Labor has been sharpening its attacks on Mr Morrison's character, attempting to cast\u00a0him as the \"liar from the Shire\".", "In recent weeks Mr Morrison has been accused of lying to French President Emmanuel Macron and to former prime minister Malcolm Turnbull.", "Mr Albanese told Sky News Mr Morrison's accusation was extraordinary.\u00a0", "\"The problem for this Prime Minister is he has a character trait whereby he says whatever is convenient at the time regardless of what the facts are,\" Mr Albanese\u00a0said."]
